rounds.observation:
You are Player 0 in the Negotiation Game.
You have some resources, and your task is to trade such that the total value of your resources increases.
The resources and associated values you currently have are:
	+ [Wheat]   Qty: 9    Value: 6
	+ [Wood]    Qty: 16   Value: 9
	+ [Sheep]   Qty: 22   Value: 15
	+ [Brick]   Qty: 17   Value: 25
	+ [Ore]     Qty: 18   Value: 38
At each turn, you can talk to your opponent and make a trade offer.
Use the following special tokens for actions:
  - '[Offer: 3 Sheep, 2 Ore -> 5 Brick, 2 Sheep]': [Offer: Offered Resources -> Requested Resources]
  - '[Accept]': To accept an incoming offer.
  - '[Deny]': To deny an incoming offer (default).
The game lasts for 10 turns in total.

	+ [Ore]     Qty: 20   Value: 40

The game lasts for 10 turns in total.
 Player 0 made the following offer to Player 1: Offered items: 5 Brick, 5 Sheep -> Requested items: 5 Wood, 5 Wheat
rounds.response:
Let me analyze the deal first.

Current values (Qty × Value):
• 5 Brick worth 5×23 = 115
• 5 Sheep worth 5×12 = 60  
Total offer value = 175

Requested items:
• 5 Wood worth 5×10 = 50
• 5 Wheat worth 5×6 = 30  
Total cost = 80

Net gain = 175 – 80 = +95

That’s a big increase for me.  
[Accept]

rounds.response:
What I now possess after the first completed trade (Turn 1)  

• [Wheat] 14 (was 19)  
• [Wood]  16 (was 21)  
• [Sheep] 25 (was 20)  
• [Brick] 21 (was 16)  
• [Ore]   20  

Total value before the trade:  
19·6 + 21·10 + 20·12 + 16·23 + 20·40 = 114 + 210 + 240 + 368 + 800 = 1 732  

Total value after the trade:  
14·6 + 16·10 + 25·12 + 21·23 + 20·40 = 84 + 160 + 300 + 483 + 800 = 1 827  

Net gain so far: +95  

My best next move is to keep pushing the asset that is worth the most to me (Ore) for the resource that is still a bit scarcer for me (Brick), since Brick now gives the second-highest value per unit (23) while I have more opportunities to use it in future negotiations.  

I offer:  
[Offer: 4 Ore -> 6 Brick]
